help.title: What are Language Families?
help.description: Language families are global groups of related languages. They help organize languages by their historical origins and linguistic relationships. For example, 'Indo-European' is a language family that includes English, Dutch, French, and many other languages.

noDistricts.description: Get started by creating your first district for this city

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.slugHelpText: URL-friendly identifier. Only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
basicInfo.activeHelpText: Inactive districts are hidden from the public interface

info.title: About Districts
info.description: Districts are the primary geographic divisions within a city. They help organize neighborhoods and provide a hierarchical structure for organizing language data.

vsNeighborhoods.title: Districts vs Neighborhoods
vsNeighborhoods.description: Districts are larger geographic areas, while neighborhoods are smaller divisions within districts. This creates a clear hierarchy: City → District → Neighborhood.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: District names and descriptions should be translated into all supported languages (English, Dutch, French) to ensure accessibility for all users.

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.description: Once you delete a district, there is no way to undo this action. This will also delete all associated neighborhoods and any language points linked to those neighborhoods.
dangerZone.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this district? This action cannot be undone.

noNeighborhoods.title: No Neighborhoods Yet
noNeighborhoods.description: Get started by creating your first neighborhood for this city

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.districtHelpText: Select the district this neighborhood belongs to
basicInfo.slugHelpText: URL-friendly identifier. Only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
basicInfo.activeHelpText: Inactive neighborhoods are hidden from the public interface

noDistrictsWarning.title: No Districts Available
noDistrictsWarning.description: You need to create at least one district before creating neighborhoods. Neighborhoods must be assigned to a district as part of the geographic hierarchy.

info.title: About Neighborhoods
info.description: Neighborhoods are smaller geographic divisions within districts. They provide a more granular level of geographic organization for language data.

hierarchy.title: Geographic Hierarchy
hierarchy.description: The geographic hierarchy follows this structure: City → District → Neighborhood. This allows for precise organization of language points within specific areas.

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: Neighborhood names and descriptions should be translated into all supported languages (English, Dutch, French) to ensure accessibility for all users.

districtAssignment.title: District Assignment
districtAssignment.description: Each neighborhood must be assigned to a district. This creates the geographic hierarchy and allows for better organization of data.

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.description: Once you delete a neighborhood, there is no way to undo this action. This will also delete any language points linked to this neighborhood.
dangerZone.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this neighborhood? This action cannot be undone.
